channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Man Behind the End of Roe v. Wade Has Big Plans for America
item.description: In the world of political fund-raising, there is hard money, soft money, dark money — and Leonard Leo money.

item.title: Taiwanese Company Gold Apollo Says It Didn’t Make Pagers Used in Attack
item.description: The company, Gold Apollo, said it had not manufactured the devices, pointing to another company that it said was licensed to use its brand.

item.title: Many women struggle to lose belly fat in middle age. Here’s some expert help
item.description: The loss of estrogen in menopause is strongly associated with a change in body composition.

item.title: Justice Department Files $100 Million Suit in Fatal Baltimore Bridge Collapse
item.description: The crash of the Dali into the Francis Scott Key Bridge killed six people. The federal government says the owner and the operator were “grossly neglig...

item.title: What We Know About the Deadly Pager Explosions in Lebanon
item.description: The seemingly coordinated blasts targeting Hezbollah members stoked fears of a broadening conflict.

item.title: Jamie Dimon tells Gen Z to stop wasting its time on TikTok and read books instead
item.description: "If you're a Democrat, read the Republican opinion ... if you're a Republican read the Democrat one. Read history books. You can't make it up."

item.title: Pavel Kushnir Dies in a Russian Prison
item.description: Among the hundreds of Russians jailed for criticizing the war in Ukraine, the death of Pavel Kushnir in detention has transformed him into an antiwar ...

item.title: Nikki Haley’s new weekly SiriusXM talk show will last until a new president takes office
item.description: Haley says it may continue beyond that "if Americans like what they hear."

item.title: Far From Ohio, Haitian Americans Feel the Sting of Threats in Springfield
item.description: They charged Donald J. Trump and JD Vance, who spread baseless rumors that Haitians in an Ohio city were eating pets, with imperiling their community ...

item.title: Pager Attacks in Lebanon Puncture Hezbollah’s Image as Powerful Anti-Israel Force
item.description: The coordinated attacks targeting the group’s wireless devices caused thousands of injuries, piercing the group’s rank and file and raising questions ...

item.title: Here’s where to get a free burger on National Cheeseburger Day
item.description: Your lunch (and dinner!) plans are set.

item.title: Cathy Merrick, 63, Advocate for Indigenous People in Canada, Dies
item.description: She was on the front lines of dogged fights against injustices, including a recent series of murders of Indigenous women by a white man.

item.title: Amazon’s back-to-office crusade could backfire, experts say. ‘These shifts cause you to lose people’
item.description: Amazon’s new policy defies data that shows RTO mandates throttle recruitment and aren’t linked with increased productivity.
